intro: Salsola subdecandra, commonly known as desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on slender pedicels. Its leaves are usually succulent and adapted to conserve water, reflecting its ability to thrive in harsh, dry environments. Salsola subdecandra is often found in sandy soils and is considered an important component of desert ecosystems.
